item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Why wordfreq will not be updated (721 points | 203 comments)
2. 0day Contest for End-of-Life Devices Announced (64 points | 24 comments)
3. Bento: Jupyter Notebooks at Meta (32 points | 9 comments)
4. Apple mobile processors are now made in America by TSMC (1228 points | 574 comments)
5. Papermill: Parameterizing, executing, and analyzing Jupyter Notebooks (43 points | 26 comments)
6. A high-performance, zero-overhead, extensible Python compiler using LLVM (29 points | 4 comments)
7. The Dune Shell (63 points | 15 comments)
8. Launch HN: Cerebrium (YC W22) – Serverless Infrastructure Platform for ML/AI (20 points | 4 comments)
9. Gentle Guide to Self-Hosting (119 points | 42 comments)
10. Independent directors of 23andMe resign from board (540 points | 284 comments)
11. Scramble: Open-Source Alternative to Grammarly (334 points | 145 comments)
12. Knowledge graphs using Ollama and Embeddings to answer and visualizing queries (30 points | 1 comment)
13. AI tool cuts unexpected deaths in hospital by 26%, Canadian study finds (125 points | 99 comments)
14. Atkinson Hyperlegible Font (674 points | 183 comments)
15. macOS Sequoia 15 may bypass DNS encryption (502 points | 178 comments)
16. Scientists discover how many chemicals from food packaging enter our bodies (24 points | 17 comments)
17. Amazon ordered a return to the office – but research says they'll backtrack (33 points | 25 comments)
18. Home solar energy systems exploded in several areas of Beirut (10 points | 2 comments)
19. Show HN: Sol – A de-minifier for shell programs (104 points | 14 comments)
20. PeerTube 6.3 (69 points | 1 comment)
21. Cobb Tuning Hit with $2.9M Fine over Emissions Defeat Devices (31 points | 39 comments)
22. Putting Code on a Nerves Device (4 points | discuss)
23. How Raw sockets behave differently in macOS and Linux (73 points | 29 comments)
24. Fine-Tuning LLMs to 1.58bit (8 points | discuss)
25. Errors from `Close` (33 points | 16 comments)
26. Valkey 8.0.0 Is Out (5 points | 2 comments)
27. A Friendly Introduction to Assembly for High-Level Programmers (224 points | 38 comments)
28. GraalPy – A high-performance embeddable Python 3 runtime for Java (298 points | 126 comments)
29. Asgard launches world's first DDR5-9600 DIMMs (72 points | 41 comments)
30. Reports of the death of dental cavities are greatly exaggerated (172 points | 112 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 4:20 PM UTC
